topPRs.title: attachment handling fix
topPRs.author: Y4NK33420
topPRs.body:
# Relates to

[[Issue #ELI2-245: Add media attachment API for message attachments](https://linear.app/eliza-labs/issue/ELI2-245/uiux-allow-bulk-file-selection-for-chat-attachments)](https://linear.app/eliza-labs/issue/ELI2-245/uiux-allow-bulk-file-selection-for-chat-attachments)

# Risks

Low. This PR adds a new API endpoint for handling media attachments that doesn't modify any existing functionality. The only risk is potential resource consumption from large file uploads, which is mitigated by size limits and proper error handling.

# Background

## What does this PR do?

This PR implements a complete media API that allows:
- Uploading media attachments (images, documents, etc.)
- Retrieving media by ID
- Associating media with messages
- Retrieving all attachments for a specific message

The implementation uses both file system storage and runtime cache for redundancy, ensuring attachments remain available even if one storage method fails.

## What kind of change is this?

Features (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

# Documentation changes needed?

My changes include new documentation for the Media API in the form of a detailed README file in the routes directory.

# Testing

## Where should a reviewer start?

1. First, review the new server-side components:
   - `packages/cli/src/server/storage/local-storage.ts` - New file storage implementation
   - `packages/cli/src/server/utils.ts` - Utility functions for file processing
   - `packages/cli/src/server/api/index.ts` - API endpoints for media handling

2. Then review the client-side changes for attachment processing:
   - `packages/client/src/lib/socketio-manager.ts` - Enhanced to handle file uploads and attachments
   - `packages/client/src/components/chat.tsx` - UI components for attachment preview and selection
   - `packages/client/src/lib/utils.ts` - Added file processing utilities

3. Check type definitions and core functionality:
   - `packages/core/src/types.ts` - Updated type definitions for attachments
   - `packages/core/src/utils.ts` - Core utilities for attachment handling

## Detailed testing steps

1. Start the ElizaOS server with `bun dev`
2. Open the chat interface and select multiple images using the attachment button
3. Send a message with attachments and verify they're processed correctly
4. Use the developer tools to check network requests to the media API
5. Verify images are retrievable after sending
6. Test error handling by attempting to upload an oversized file

topContributors.summary: wtfsayo: Merged 2 PRs (#4858 and #4857) with a total of +249/-53 lines, while also opening PR #4856 focused on fixing agent thinking and client message processing. Made significant code changes across 50 files (+1118/-774 lines) with a primary focus on other work (73%) and bugfixes (27%).

lalalune: Made significant code changes by modifying 89 files, resulting in a net change of +4588/-15808 lines, while also actively commenting on an issue. Maintained a consistent work pattern, being active every day.
